title: Former HP Executive Vyomesh Joshi Joins Conduce Inc. Advisory Board
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/3/2015 @ 11:15 AM   Conduce Inc. 
CARPINTERIA, Calif., Sept. 3, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- Vyomesh I. Joshi has accepted an appointment to the Advisory Board of Conduce Inc. The Conduce Advisory Board leverages the expertise and counsel of senior technology and business leaders who serve as thought partners to Conduce executive management. Mr. Joshi, also known as VJ, spent his entire career with Hewlett-Packard Company, most recently as Executive Vice President of the company's Imaging and Printing Group. He was also the executive sponsor for all HP operations and initiatives in India and served on HP's Executive Council. He joined the company in 1980 was the last top HP executive to have direct ties to Hewlett-Packard's founders William Hewlett and David Packard. 
"Conduce technology is the platform for the digital enterprise. In my experience, there is nothing in the marketplace that does what Conduce does," noted Mr. Joshi. "Conduce interfaces with any type of hardware, software or data and leaves the data exactly where it is to avoid any need for costly, time-consuming integration. Individuals throughout any organization can see their data, understand its significance and make better-informed decisions. If I'd had this technology when I was at HP, it would have changed the way we operated. Conduce can help any enterprise increase revenues while reducing costs. As the volume of data within organizations expands, it's difficult to overstate the significance of what Conduce offers." 
"We welcome VJ to our Advisory Board with tremendous appreciation and enthusiasm," Conduce CEO Kevin Parent said. "Over a decade of experience running HP's imaging and printing business throughout the world affords VJ a unique vantage point on the complex challenges of the world's largest enterprises. Having VJ on our team opens up significant opportunities for Conduce." 
Mr. Joshi also serves on the Board of Directors of Immy Inc., Wipro Ltd. and Harris Corporation and as a Member of Dean's Advisory Council at The Rady School of Management at the University of California, San Diego. He served as a Director at Yahoo! Inc. from 2005 to 2012. He holds a Master's degree in Electrical Engineering from Ohio State University and Bachelor's degree from L.D. College of Engineering in Ahmedabad, India. 
About Conduce 
For all of the data the world's organizations are creating, in all of its forms and uses, too much of it is locked away from the people who need it most. Too many decisions are being made with only partial information. Too many integration projects just don't work. Conduce is here to change that forever. Conduce technology unifies any data from any internal or external sources in a single, intuitive visual interface - without requiring any integration. It allows your people not just to find information, but discover its significance - and act on it instantly. Conduce illuminates what was previously impenetrable. Conduce revolutionizes decision making and leadership. Conduce unlocks your data's power, and unleashes your organization's full potential. Learn more at Conduce.com.
